info.title: HMPPS Integration API
info.description: A long-lived API that exposes data from HMPPS systems such as the National Offender Management Information System (NOMIS), nDelius (probation system) and Offender Assessment System (OASys), providing a single point of entry for consumers.

get.summary: Get visit information for a visit by visit reference.

parameters.name: visitReference
parameters.description: The visit reference number relating to the visit.

200.description: Successfully found visit information for a given visit reference.

put.summary: Report the update of a visit in an external system.
put.description:
This API only validates the existence of the entities included. It does not perform any checking of the suitability of the visit. That responsibility is left to the client.

Applicable filters:
  • prisons

parameters.name: visitReference
parameters.description: The visit reference number relating to the visit.

200.description: Successfully wrote to visit queue.

put.summary: Notify that a person has expressed an interest in a particular job.

parameters.name: hmppsId
parameters.description: A HMPPS identifier

parameters.name: jobid
parameters.description: A job identifier

200.description: Successfully submitted an expression of interest
OK
OK
OK

post.summary: Report the creation of a visit in an external system.
post.description:
This API only validates the existence of the entities included. It does not perform any checking of the suitability of the visit. That responsibility is left to the client.

Applicable filters:
  • prisons

200.description: Successfully wrote to visit queue.

post.summary: Report the cancellation of a visit in an external system.

parameters.name: visitReference
parameters.description: The visit reference number relating to the visit.

200.description: Successfully wrote to visit queue.

parameters.name: prisonId
parameters.description: The ID of the prison that holds the account

parameters.name: hmppsId
parameters.description: The HMPPS ID of the person

200.description: Successfully created a transaction.

post.summary: Transfer funds between the accounts of a prisoner.
post.description:
Currently only able to move from spends to savings.

Applicable filters:
  • prisons

parameters.name: prisonId
parameters.description: The ID of the prison that holds the account

parameters.name: hmppsId
parameters.description: The HMPPS ID of the person

200.description: Successfully created a transaction transfer.

post.summary: Temporarily mark a location as inactive. The location must be a cell.

parameters.name: prisonId
parameters.description: The ID of the prison the location is in

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the location, must be a cell

200.description: Successfully posted to upstream APIs.

post.summary: Notify that a person has had a change in status to their Assessments in relation to their in-prison Education.

parameters.name: hmppsId
parameters.description: A HMPPS person identifier

200.description: Successful notification of change of Education Assessments status

get.summary: Get visit references from given client reference.

parameters.name: clientReference
parameters.description: The visit reference number relating to the visit.

200.description: Successfully found visit references for a given client reference.

get.summary: Searches for visits by prisonId and criteria.

parameters.name: prisonId
parameters.description: The ID of the prison to be queried against

parameters.name: hmppsId
parameters.description: The HMPPS ID of the person

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: The start date of the visit

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: The end date of the visit

parameters.name: visitStatus
parameters.description: The status of the visit. (BOOKED or CANCELLED)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The maximum number of results for a page

200.description: Successfully performed the query on upstream APIs. An empty list is returned when no results are found.

get.summary: Gets the residential hierarchy for a prison.

parameters.name: prisonId
parameters.description: The ID of the prison to be queried against

parameters.name: includeInactive
parameters.description: Include temporarily inactive locations

200.description: Successfully performed the query on upstream APIs. An empty list is returned when no results are found.

get.summary: Gets the residential details for a prison.

parameters.name: prisonId
parameters.description: The ID of the prison to be queried against

parameters.name: parentPathHierarchy
parameters.description: Parent location path hierarchy, can be a Wing code, or landing code

200.description: Successfully performed the query on upstream APIs. An empty list is returned when no results are found.

get.summary: Returns details for a transaction by clientUniqueRef.
get.description:
The clientUniqueRef will not be present on the response.
Applicable filters:
  • prisons

parameters.name: prisonId
parameters.description: The HMPPS ID of the person

parameters.name: hmppsId
parameters.description: The ID of the prison that holds the account

parameters.name: clientUniqueRef
parameters.description: The clientUniqueRef used when the transaction was created

200.description: Successfully found a transaction.

400.description: The request data has an invalid format or the prisoner does not have transaction associated with the clientUniqueRef.

get.summary: Returns a single prisoners list of non associates.
get.description:
Applicable filters:
  • prisons

includeOpen is true by default, includeClosed is false by default. At least one must be true.

parameters.name: hmppsId
parameters.description: The HMPPS ID of the prisoner

parameters.name: prisonId
parameters.description: The prison ID of the prisoner

200.description: Successfully found prisoner's non associates.

400.description: The HMPPS ID provided has an invalid format.

get.summary: Returns all accounts for a prisoner that they have at a prison.

200.description: Successfully found a prisoner's accounts.

400.description: The HMPPS ID provided has an invalid format or the prisoner does hot have accounts at the specified prison.

get.summary: Returns all transactions for a prisoner associated with an account code that they have at a prison.
get.description:
The clientUniqueRef will only be present if it was specified by an API client.
Applicable filters:
  • prisons

parameters.name: hmppsId
parameters.description: The HMPPS ID of the person

parameters.name: prisonId
parameters.description: The ID of the prison that holds the account

parameters.name: accountCode
parameters.description: The code of the account to be accessed, one of 'spends', 'savings' or 'cash'

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Start date for transactions (defaults to today if not supplied)

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: To date for transactions (defaults to today if not supplied)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number (starting from 1)

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The maximum number of results for a page

200.description: Successfully found a prisoner's transactions.

400.description: The request data has an invalid format or the prisoner does hot have transactions at the specified prison.

get.summary: Returns a specific account for a prisoner that they have at a prison, based on the account code provided.

200.description: Successfully found a prisoner's account.

400.description: The HMPPS ID provided has an invalid format, the account code is not one of the allowable accounts or the prisoner does hot have accounts at the specified prison.

get.summary: Gets the prison regime for a prison.

get.summary: Returns person(s) by search criteria, sorted by date of birth (newest first). Only queries prisoner search.

parameters.name: first_name
parameters.description: The first name of the person

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: The last name of the person

parameters.name: date_of_birth
parameters.description: The date of birth of the person

parameters.name: search_within_aliases
parameters.description: Whether to return results that match the search criteria within the aliases of a person.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number (starting from 1)

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The maximum number of results for a page

200.description: Successfully performed the query on upstream APIs. An empty list is returned when no results are found.

400.description: There were no query parameters passed in. At least one must be specified.

get.summary: Returns a single prisoners details given an hmppsId, does not query for a probation person.

400.description: The HMPPS ID provided has an invalid format.

get.summary: Returns person(s) by search criteria, sorted by date of birth (newest first). At least one query parameter must be specified.

parameters.description: The first name of the person

parameters.name: last_name
parameters.description: The last name of the person

parameters.name: pnc_number
parameters.description: A URL-encoded pnc identifier

parameters.name: date_of_birth

parameters.name: search_within_aliases
parameters.description: Whether to return results that match the search criteria within the aliases of a person.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number (starting from 1)

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The maximum number of results for a page

200.description: Successfully performed the query on upstream APIs. An empty list is returned when no results are found.

400.description: There were no query parameters passed in. At least one must be specified.

get.summary: Get the restrictions for a visitor.

get.summary:
Returns offences associated with a person, ordered by startDate (newest first).
      > Note: This API does not contain the complete list of offences for a person.
      > Offences are retrieved from Prison and Probation systems exclusively.
      > Prison systems record only custodial sentences, while Probation systems record only the main offence and some additional offences for case management purposes. Other offences recorded by HMCTS and police may not be included.

parameters.name: hmppsId
parameters.description: The HMPPS ID of the person

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number (starting from 1)

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The maximum number of results for a page

200.description: Successfully found offences for a person with the provided HMPPS ID.

data.description: Commit an act / series of acts with intent to pervert the course of public justice

get.summary: Returns metadata of images associated with a person sorted by captureDateTime (newest first).

parameters.description: The maximum number of results for a page

200.description: Successfully found a person with the provided HMPPS ID. If a person doesn't have any images, then an empty list (`[]`) is returned in the `data` property.

get.summary:
Returns criminogenic needs associated with a person. This endpoint does not serve LAO (Limited Access Offender) data.

      Note: Criminogenic needs are dynamic factors that are directly linked to criminal behaviour. Eight criminogenic needs are measured in OASys: Accommodation, Employability, Relationships, Lifestyle and Associates, Drug Misuse, Alcohol Misuse, Thinking & Behaviour and Attitudes. These are scored according to whether there is “no need”, “some need” or “severe need”, and a need is identified in a specific section based on calculations around these scores.
            However, the process by which needs are assessed is changing as early as next year (2024), specifically moving to a strength-based model that seeks to identify and develop the strengths of people with convictions. As a consequence of this, the information provided by this endpoint will also change.

parameters.name: encodedHmppsId
parameters.description: A URL-encoded HMPPS identifier

200.description: Successfully found criminogenic needs for a person with the provided HMPPS ID.

get.summary: Return nomis number for a given HMPPS ID
get.description:
Accepts a HMPPS ID (hmppsId) and looks up the corresponding nomis number.
Applicable filters:
  • prisons

200.description: OK

404.description: Nomis number could not be found.

get.summary: Return a HMPPS ID for a given nomis number

200.description: OK

404.description: Nomis number could not be found.

get.summary: Return a HMPPS ID for a given nomis number

200.description: OK

404.description: Nomis number could not be found.

get.summary: Probation case information for the Effective Proposals Framework service
get.description:
Accepts an HMPPS Id (hmppsId) and Delius Event number
      and returns a data structure giving background information on the probation case
      for use in the Effective Proposals Framework system. The information is used to
      reduce the need for the EPF user to re-key information already held in Delius.

200.description: OK

200.description: Successfully found contact by contact ID.

400.description: The contact is in invalid format.

200.description: OK

startTimestamp.description: The date and time of the visit

endTimestamp.description: The finishing date and time of the visit

visitNotes.description: Visit Notes - only 1 note of each type is allowed

visitors.description: List of visitors associated with the visit

visitorSupport.description: Additional support associated with the visit

text.example: Visitor is concerned that his mother in-law is coming!

visitContact.description: true if visitor is the contact for the visit otherwise false

clientVisitReference.example: Reference ID in the client system

startTimestamp.description: The date and time of the visit

endTimestamp.description: The finishing date and time of the visit

visitNotes.description: Visit Notes - only 1 note of each type is allowed

createDateTime.description: The date and time of when the visit was created in the client system

visitors.description: List of visitors associated with the visit

visitorSupport.description: Additional support associated with the visit

userType.description: Type of user cancelling the visit

actionedBy.description: Username for user who actioned this request

type.description: Transaction type. Determines which accounts will be debited and credited.

amount.description: Amount of money in pence, must be positive. Whether the transaction is a credit or debit is determined by the type.

clientUniqueRef.description: A reference unique to the client making the post. Maximum size 64 characters, only alphabetic, numeric, '-' and '_' are allowed.

amount.description: Amount of money in pence, must be positive.

clientUniqueRef.description: A reference unique to the client making the post. Maximum size 64 characters, only alphabetic, numeric, '-' and '_' are allowed.

fromAccount.description: The account to move money from. Must be 'spends'.

toAccount.description: The account to move money to. Must be 'savings'.

debitTransactionId.description: Transaction id for the debit portion of the transaction.

creditTransactionId.description: Transaction id for the credit portion of the transaction.

transactionId.description: Transaction id for the whole transaction.

deactivationReasonDescription.description: Additional information on deactivation, for OTHER DeactivatedReason must be provided

status.description: The current status of the Assessments

statusChangeDate.description: The ISO-8601 formatted date that the status changed.

detailUrl.description: The URL of where to get the person's current Education Assessments

requestId.description: A unique request identifier generated by the consumer to allow for tracing requests through the various systems. The format is to be defined by the consumer but a UUID is suggested.

startTimestamp.description: The date and time of the visit

endTimestamp.description: The finishing date and time of the visit

visitors.description: List of visitors associated with the visit

visitorSupport.description: Additional support associated with the visit

visitExternalSystemDetails.description: External system details associated with the visit

createdTimestamp.description: The visit created date and time

modifiedTimestamp.description: The visit modified date and time

firstBookedDateTime.description: Date the visit was first booked or migrated

clientVisitReference.example: Reference ID in the client system

visitContact.description: true if visitor is the contact for the visit otherwise false

isLastPage.description: Is the current page the last one?

count.description: The number of results in `data` for the current page

perPage.description: The maximum number of results in `data` for a page

totalCount.description: The total number of results in `data` across all pages

fullLocationPath.description: Full path of the location within the prison

localName.description: Alternative description to display for location, (Not Cells)

level.description: Current Level within hierarchy, starts at 1, e.g Wing = 1

pathHierarchy.description: Full path of the location within the prison

localName.description: Alternative description to display for location, (Not Cells)

comments.description: Additional comments that can be made about this location

oldWorkingCapacity.description: When a cell is inactive, show the active working capacity value

certification.description: Indicates that this location is certified for use as a residential location

deactivatedByParent.description: Indicates the location in inactive as a parent is deactivated

deactivationReasonDescription.description: For OTHER deactivation reason, a free text comment is provided

deactivatedBy.description: Staff username who deactivated the location

proposedReactivationDate.description: Estimated reactivation date for location reactivation

level.description: Current Level within hierarchy, starts at 1, e.g Wing = 1

parentLocationKey.description: Business Key for the parent location

inactiveCells.description: Number of inactive cells below this location

numberOfCellLocations.description: Total number of non-structural locations are below this level, e.g. cells and rooms

isResidential.description: Indicates if the location is a residential location

certified.description: Indicates that this location is certified for use as a residential location

capacityOfCertifiedCell.description: Indicates the capacity of the certified location (cell)

topLevelLocationType.description: The top level type of locations

subLocationName.description: The description of the type of sub locations most common

parentLocation.description: The current parent location (e.g Wing or Landing) details

subLocations.description: All residential locations under this parent

id.description: The ID of the non association

role.description: The prisoner's role code in the non-association

roleDescription.description: The description of the prisoner's role in the non-association

reason.description: The reason code why these prisoners should be kept apart

reasonDescription.description: The reason description why these prisoners should be kept apart

comment.description: Explanation of why prisoners are non-associated
comment.example: John and Luke always end up fighting

authorisedBy.description: User ID of the person who created the non-association.

whenUpdated.description: When the non-association was last updated

updatedBy.description: User ID of the person who last updated the non-association

isClosed.description: Whether the non-association is closed or is in effect

closedBy.description: User ID of the person who closed the non-association. Only present when the non-association is closed, null for open non-associations

closedReason.description: Reason why the non-association was closed. Only present when the non-association is closed, null for open non-associations

closedAt.description: Date and time of when the non-association was closed. Only present when the non-association is closed, null for open non-associations

otherPrisonerDetails.description: Details about the other person in the non-association.

isOpen.description: Whether the non-association is open or closed

role.description: Other prisoner’s role code in the non-association

roleDescription.description: Other prisoner’s role description in the non-association

cellLocation.description: Cell the prisoner is assigned to

amStart.description: The start time for the am slot

amFinish.description: The end time for the am slot

pmStart.description: The start time for the pm slot

pmFinish.description: The end time for the pm slot

edStart.description: The start time for the ed slot

edFinish.description: The end time for the ed slot

dayOfWeek.description: The day of week the regime is applicable to

id.description: The internally-generated ID for this prison pay band

alias.description: The alternative text to use in place of the description

description.description: The description of pay band in this prison

Identifiers.description: Other unique identifiers for a person.

croNumber.description: A Criminal Records Office identifier from National Identification Service (NIS) or National Automated Fingerprint Identification System (NAFIS).

deliusCrn.description: A Case Reference Number from Delius.

pncId.description: An identifier from the Police National Computer (PNC)

receptionDate.description: Date prisoner was received into the prison

youthOffender.description: Is the prisoner a youth offender

dateCreated.description: Date of the alert, which might differ from the date it was created

pncId.description: An identifier from the Police National Computer (PNC)

restrictionTypeDescription.description: The description of the restriction type

enteredByUsername.description: The username of either the person who created the restriction or the last person to update it if it has been modified

enteredByDisplayName.description: The display name of either the person who created the restriction or the last person to update it if it has been modified

createdTime.description: Timestamp when the entry was created

updatedTime.description: Timestamp when the entry was updated

startDate.description: Date from which the restrictions applies

expiryDate.description: Date restriction applies to, or indefinitely if null

active.description: True if restriction is within the start date and optional expiry date range

remainingPrivilegeVisitOrders.description: The prisoners remaining privilege visit orders

serviceSource.description:
Which upstream API service the sentence originates from. Possible values are:
      `PRISON_API`,
      `NDELIUS`

systemSource.description:
Which upstream API system the sentence originates from. Possible values are:
      `PRISON_SYSTEMS`,
      `PROBATION_SYSTEMS`

fineAmount.description: The amount of fine related to the sentence and offence

units.description:
Time unit that is used in combination with the duration field. Possible values are:
      `Hours`,
      `Days`,
      `Weeks`,
      `Months`,
      `Years`

years.description: Number of years in the term

months.description: Number of months in the term

weeks.description: Number of weeks in the term

days.description: Number of days in the term

hours.description: Number of hours in the term

prisonTermCode.description:
The sentence term code
      Possible values are:
      `CUR` - Curfew Period,
      `DEF` - Deferment Period,
      `DET` - Detention,
      `HOURS` - Hours Ordered,
      `IMP` - Imprisonment,
      `LIC` - Licence,
      `PSYCH` - Psychiatric Hospital,
      `SCUS` - Custodial Period,
      `SEC104` - Breach of supervision requirements,
      `SEC105` - Breach due to imprisonable offence,
      `SEC86` - Section 86 of 2000 Act,
      `SUP` - Sentence Length,
      `SUSP` - Suspension Period

classificationCode.description: The classification code of the risk

nomisNumber.description: The Nomis number of the person.

reference.description: The UUID reference for the review schedule record.

reviewDateFrom.description: The earliest date that the review should be carried out.

reviewDateTo.description: The latest date that the review should be carried out.

status.description:
The status of this review schedule possible values are:
        SCHEDULED
        EXEMPT_PRISONER_DRUG_OR_ALCOHOL_DEPENDENCY
        EXEMPT_PRISONER_OTHER_HEALTH_ISSUES
        EXEMPT_PRISONER_FAILED_TO_ENGAGE
        EXEMPT_PRISONER_ESCAPED_OR_ABSCONDED
        EXEMPT_PRISONER_SAFETY_ISSUES
        EXEMPT_PRISON_REGIME_CIRCUMSTANCES
        EXEMPT_PRISON_STAFF_REDEPLOYMENT
        EXEMPT_PRISON_OPERATION_OR_SECURITY_ISSUE
        EXEMPT_SECURITY_ISSUE_RISK_TO_STAFF
        EXEMPT_SYSTEM_TECHNICAL_ISSUE
        EXEMPT_PRISONER_TRANSFER
        EXEMPT_PRISONER_RELEASE
        EXEMPT_PRISONER_DEATH
        EXEMPT_PRISONER_MERGE
        EXEMPT_UNKNOWN
        COMPLETED

calculationRule.description:
The calculation rule that was used to workout the review schedule window.
      Possible values are:
          PRISONER_READMISSION
          PRISONER_TRANSFER
          BETWEEN_RELEASE_AND_3_MONTHS_TO_SERVE
          BETWEEN_3_MONTHS_AND_3_MONTHS_7_DAYS_TO_SERVE
          BETWEEN_3_MONTHS_8_DAYS_AND_6_MONTHS_TO_SERVE
          BETWEEN_6_AND_12_MONTHS_TO_SERVE
          BETWEEN_12_AND_60_MONTHS_TO_SERVE
          MORE_THAN_60_MONTHS_TO_SERVE
          INDETERMINATE_SENTENCE
          PRISONER_ON_REMAND
          PRISONER_UN_SENTENCED

version.description:
The review schedule can change status numerous times.
      The version number indicates which version of the review schedule this one is, the higher the number the newer the update.
      use the version number in conjunction with the reference UUID.
      ie if you group the schedules by reference then the version numbers represent different versions of the same schedule.
      The final status of each grouping is COMPLETED.

reviewCompletedBy.description: When the review schedule has a completed review this will be populated by the name of the person who did the review.

reviewCompletedByRole.description: When the review schedule has a completed review this will be populated by the role of the person who did the review.

reviewCompletedAt.description: When the review schedule has a completed review this will be populated with the date that the CIAG entered into the system when completing the Review. It is the date that the user did the Review in person, rather than the date that it was entered into the system..

reviewType.description:
When the review schedule has a completed review this will be populated with the type of the review.
      values are:
        REGULAR,
        PRE_RELEASE

reviewReason.description:
When the review schedule has a completed review this will be populated with the reason for the review.
      values are:
        REOFFENCE,
        TRANSFER,
        REGULAR

reviewSchedules.description:
A list of review schedules for this prisoner.
       Note that this will return multiple versions of the the same schedule.
       This is because down stream clients need to know the previous states of the review schedules.
       grouping by reference and then ordering by highest version number will present the review schedules with the most up to date data.

deadlineDate.description: An ISO-8601 date representing when the Induction should be completed by.

status.description:
The current status of the Induction Schedule.
      list of values:
          SCHEDULED
          COMPLETED
          EXEMPT_PRISONER_DRUG_OR_ALCOHOL_DEPENDENCY
          EXEMPT_PRISONER_OTHER_HEALTH_ISSUES
          EXEMPT_PRISONER_FAILED_TO_ENGAGE
          EXEMPT_PRISONER_ESCAPED_OR_ABSCONDED
          EXEMPT_PRISONER_SAFETY_ISSUES
          EXEMPT_PRISON_REGIME_CIRCUMSTANCES
          EXEMPT_PRISON_STAFF_REDEPLOYMENT
          EXEMPT_PRISON_OPERATION_OR_SECURITY_ISSUE
          EXEMPT_SECURITY_ISSUE_RISK_TO_STAFF
          EXEMPT_SYSTEM_TECHNICAL_ISSUE
          EXEMPT_PRISONER_TRANSFER
          EXEMPT_PRISONER_RELEASE
          EXEMPT_PRISONER_DEATH
          EXEMPT_SCREENING_AND_ASSESSMENT_IN_PROGRESS
          EXEMPT_SCREENING_AND_ASSESSMENT_INCOMPLETE
          EXEMPT_PRISONER_MERGE

calculationRule.description:
The Induction Schedule rule used to determine deadline date.
        list of values are:
          NEW_PRISON_ADMISSION
          EXISTING_PRISONER_LESS_THAN_6_MONTHS_TO_SERVE
          EXISTING_PRISONER_BETWEEN_6_AND_12_MONTHS_TO_SERVE
          EXISTING_PRISONER_BETWEEN_12_AND_60_MONTHS_TO_SERVE
          EXISTING_PRISONER_INDETERMINATE_SENTENCE
          EXISTING_PRISONER_ON_REMAND
          EXISTING_PRISONER_UN_SENTENCED

nomisNumber.description: The Nomis number of the person.

systemCreatedBy.description: The name of the person who used the PLP system to create the Induction Schedule, or 'system' for system generated updates.

systemCreatedAt.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp representing the time the PLP system was used to create the Induction Schedule.

systemCreatedAtPrison.description: The code of the prison where the induction was Created

systemUpdatedBy.description:
The name of the person who performed the Induction with the prisoner.
      In the case of system generated updates or setting an exemption this field will not be present.

systemUpdatedAt.description: An ISO-8601 timestamp representing the time the PLP system was used to update the Induction Schedule.

systemUpdatedAtPrison.description: The code of the prison where the induction was updated

inductionPerformedBy.description:
The name of the person who performed the Induction with the prisoner.
      In the case of system generated updates or setting an exemption this field will not be present.

inductionPerformedAt.description: When the induction schedule has a completed induction this will be populated with the date that the CIAG entered into the system when completing the Induction. It is the date that the user did the Induction in person, rather than the date that it was entered into the system.

inductionPerformedByRole.description:
The role of the person who performed the Induction with the prisoner.
      In the case of system generated updates or setting an exemption this field will not be present.

inductionPerformedAtPrison.description: The prison code that the induction was performed at.

exemptionReason.description: If reason the induction schedule was exempted.

version.description:
The induction schedule can change status numerous times.
      When looking at the plp-induction-schedule/history of the inductions.
      The version number indicates which version of the induction schedule this one is,
      the higher the number the newer the update.

inductionSchedules.description:
A list of induction schedule versions for this prisoner.
       The prisoner will only have one induction schedule but for various reasons the schedule can be updated.
       This list will show each change the schedule has been through. This allows for reports to be generated.

code.description: The prison code, which is usually short for the prison name.

readSkill.description: Read skill level (e.g., Y for yes, N for no)

writeSkill.description: Write skill level (e.g., Y for yes, N for no)

speakSkill.description: Speak skill level (e.g., Y for yes, N for no)

id.description: The Image ID, in reference to a unique identifier.

active.description: A flag to indicate whether an image is in active use. It is no guarantee that the latest uploaded image will be the active one.

captureDateTime.description: The Date and Time of when the image was captured.

view.description:
View is the subject focus; describing the inner focus or subject of the image, normally referring to a marking, tattoo or deeper level focus of the orientation. In practise this is the interior foci of what is captured in the 'orientation' field.
      Possible values are:
      `FACE` - Facing,
      `TAT` - Tattoo,
      `OTH` - Other,
      `SCAR` - Scar,
      `MARK` - Mark,
      `OIC` - Offence in Custody

orientation.description:
Orientation is the scope focus; describing the scope or outer focus of the image, normally referring to the highest level object of interest within the bounds of the photo itself. This is normally a body part or an angle of photography, such as a photo of someone’s facial view (`FRONT`) or arm (`ARM`).
      Possible values are:
      `ANKLE` - Ankle,
      `ARM` - Arm,
      `DAMAGE` - Damage,
      `EAR` - Ear,
      `ELBOW` - Elbow,
      `FACE` - Face,
      `FIGHT` - Fight,
      `FINGER` - Finger,
      `FOOT` - Foot,
      `FRONT` - Front Facial View,
      `HAND` - Hand,
      `HEAD` - Head,
      `INCIDENT` - Incident,
      `INJURY` - Injury,
      `KNEE` - Knee,
      `LEG` - Leg,
      `LIP` - Lip,
      `NECK` - Neck,
      `NOSE` - Nose,
      `SHOULDER` - Shoulder,
      `THIGH` - Thigh,
      `TOE` - Toe,
      `TORSO` - Torso

type.description:
Type is the contextual focus; describing the context or scenario the image was taken within. It could be for a particular purpose or capturing the results of a particular type of incident.
      Possible values are:
      `OFF_BKG` - Offender Booking,
      `OFF_IDM` - Offender Identification Marks,
      `OIC` - Offence In Custody,
      `PPTY` - Property Image

value.description: Catering instructions relating to the prisoner.

foodAllergies.description: List of food allergies for a prisoner.

medicalDietaryRequirements.description: List of medical dietary requirements for a prisoner.

personalisedDietaryRequirements.description: List of personalised dietary requirements for a prisoner.

comment.description: Any other comments relating to the allergy.

diet.description: Diet information for a prisoner, specifically relating to any allergies or dietary requirements.

smoking.description: Details of whether a prisoner smokes or vapes.

comment.description: Any other comments relating to the dietary requirement.
Any other comments relating to the dietary requirement.

lastName.description: The last name of the contact

firstName.description: The first name of the contact

middleNames.description: The middle names of the contact, if any

dateOfBirth.description: The date of birth of the contact, if known

property.description: Building or house number or name

cityDescription.description: The description of the city code

primaryAddress.description: True if this is the primary address otherwise false

mailAddress.description: If true this address should be considered for sending mail to

phoneTypeDescription.description: Description of the type of phone

contact.description: The details of a contact as an individual

relationship.description: The details of the relationship between the prisoner and this contact

relationshipTypeCode.description: Coded value indicating either a social or official contact. This is a coded value from the group code CONTACT_TYPE in reference data

relationshipTypeDescription.description: The description of the relationship type

relationshipToPrisonerCode.description: The relationship to the prisoner. A code from SOCIAL_RELATIONSHIP or OFFICIAL_RELATIONSHIP reference data groups depending on the relationship type

relationshipToPrisonerDescription.description: The description of the relationship to the prisoner

approvedVisitor.description: Indicates whether the contact is an approved visitor

nextOfKin.description: Is this contact the prisoner's next of kin?

emergencyContact.description: Is this contact the prisoner's emergency contact?

isRelationshipActive.description: Is this contact the prisoner's next of kin?

currentTerm.description: Is this relationship active for the current booking?

creationDateTime.description: Date and Time of Case Note creation

occurrenceDateTime.description: Date and Time of when case note contact with offender was made

amendments.description: List of amendments to the case note

id.description: The ID of the Case Note in uuid format

creationDateTime.description: Date and Time of Case Note creation

name.example: Name of the building of residence

noFixedAddress.description: Indicates whether the person has a permanent place of residence

description.example: Serious Further Offence - Subject to SFO review/investigation

earlyRemovalSchemeEligibilityDate.description: the date on which offender will be eligible for early removal (under the Early Removal Scheme for foreign nationals).

releaseOnTemporaryLicenceDate.description: the date on which offender will be released on temporary licence.

tariffDate.description: date on which minimum term is reached for parole (indeterminate/life sentences).

date.description: Release date for non-DTO sentence (if applicable). This will be based on one of ARD, CRD, NPD or PRRD. NonDto stands for Non-Detention training order.

releaseDateType.description:
Indicates which type of non-DTO release date is the effective release date. One of 'ARD', 'CRD', 'NPD' or 'PRRD'. Possible values are:
      `ARD`,
      `CRD`,
      `NPD`,
      `PRRD`.

date.description:
Confirmed, actual, approved, provisional or calculated release date for offender, according to offender release date algorithm.

      Algorithm
      If there is a confirmed release date, the offender release date is the confirmed release date.
      If there is no confirmed release date for the offender, the offender release date is either the actual parole date or the home detention curfew actual date.
      If there is no confirmed release date, actual parole date or home detention curfew actual date for the offender, the release date is the later of the nonDtoReleaseDate or midTermDate value (if either or both are present)

lawfullyAtLarge.description: Number of lawfully at large days

restoredAdditionalDaysAwarded.description: Number of restored additional days awarded

recallSentenceRemand.description: Number of recall sentence remand days

recallSentenceTaggedBail.description: Number of recall sentence tagged bail days

expiryCalculatedDate.description: date on which sentence expired (as calculated by NOMIS).
(calculated) - top-up supervision expiry date for offender.

expiryDate.description: top-up supervision expiry date for offender.

expiryOverrideDate.description: (override) - top-up supervision expiry date for offender.

startDate.description: Top-up supervision start date for offender - calculated as licence end date + 1 day or releaseDate if licence end date not set.

escapeOrAbscond.description:
Risk of escape/abscond. Possible values are:
      `YES`,
      `NO`,
      `DK`,
      `NA`

controlIssuesDisruptiveBehaviour.description:
Risk control issues/disruptive behaviour. Possible values are:
      `YES`,
      `NO`,
      `DK`,
      `NA`

breachOfTrust.description:
Risk of breach of trust. Possible values are:
      `YES`,
      `NO`,
      `DK`,
      `NA`

riskToOtherPrisoners.description:
Risk to other prisoners. Possible values are:
      `YES`,
      `NO`,
      `DK`,
      `NA`

risk.description:
Presence of risk. Possible values are:
      `YES`,
      `NO`,
      `DK`,
      `NA`

previousConcernsText.description: Supporting comments for any previous concerns.
previousConcernsText.example: Risk of self harm concerns due to ...

currentConcernsText.description: Supporting comments for any current concerns.
currentConcernsText.example: Risk of self harm concerns due to ...

whoIsAtRisk.example: X, Y and Z are at risk

natureOfRisk.description: What is the nature of the risk
natureOfRisk.example: The nature of the risk is X

riskImminence.description: When is the risk likely to be greatest. Consider the timescale and indicate whether risk is immediate or not. Consider the risks in custody as well as on release.
riskImminence.example: The risk is imminent and more probable in X situation

riskIncreaseFactors.description: What circumstances are likely to increase risk. Describe factors, actions, events which might increase level of risk, now and in the future.
riskIncreaseFactors.example: If offender in situation X the risk can be higher

riskMitigationFactors.description: What factors are likely to reduce the risk. Describe factors, actions, and events which may reduce or contain the level of risk. What has previously stopped them?
riskMitigationFactors.example: Giving offender therapy in X will reduce the risk

riskInCommunity.description: Assess the risk of serious harm the offender poses on the basis that they could be released imminently back into the community. This field is a map which can return all or some of the properties given.

riskInCustody.description: Assess both the risk of serious harm the offender presents now, in custody, and the risk they could present to others whilst in a custodial setting. This field is a map which can return all or some of the properties given.

scoreLevel.description:
Indicator for general prediction. Possible values are:
    `LOW`,
    `MEDIUM`,
    `HIGH`,
    `VERY_HIGH`,
    `NOT_APPLICABLE`

Indicator for risk of group reconviction. Possible values are:
      `LOW`,
      `MEDIUM`,
      `HIGH`,
      `VERY_HIGH`,
      `NOT_APPLICABLE`

Indicator for risk of serious recidivism. Possible values are:
        `LOW`,
        `MEDIUM`,
        `HIGH`,
        `VERY_HIGH`,
        `NOT_APPLICABLE`

assessmentStatus.description:
Whether the risk score calculation is complete. Possible values are:
      `COMPLETE`,
      `LOCKED_INCOMPLETE`

indecentScoreLevel.description:
Indicator for risk of sexual indecency. Possible values are:
      `LOW`,
      `MEDIUM`,
      `HIGH`,
      `VERY_HIGH`,
      `NOT_APPLICABLE`,

contactScoreLevel.description:
Indicator for risk of sexual contact. Possible values are:
      `LOW`,
      `MEDIUM`,
      `HIGH`,
      `VERY_HIGH`,
      `NOT_APPLICABLE`,

scoreLevel.description:
Indicator for risk of violence. Possible values are:
    `LOW`,
    `MEDIUM`,
    `HIGH`,
    `VERY_HIGH`,
    `NOT_APPLICABLE`

description.example: Child Concerns - Safeguarding concerns where a child is at risk from the offender

assessmentId.description: The unique ID of the risk management plan

dateCompleted.description: The date that the risk management plan was completed

keyInformationCurrentSituation.description: Key information about the current situation of the subject being assessed

furtherConsiderationsCurrentSituation.description: Further considerations about the situation of the subject being assessed

supervision.description: Who they see, when and why, any support they get from their community, and how well they're desisting from problematic behaviour

monitoringAndControl.description: Information on restrictions in place to prevent reoffending, what steps have been taken to monitor potential reoffending, including license conditions, community order requirements, PPM restrictions and such.

interventionsAndTreatment.description: Interventions delivered to develop controls and protective factors to reduce risk of reoffending, including practical support, requirements to support interventions and details of who and where these interventions will be administered.

victimSafetyPlanning.description: Restrictions in place to specifically protect victims of, adults known to, and children potentially at risk from the offender.

contingencyPlans.description: Future plans in the form "If X happens, we will do Y...." for if parts of the risk management plan break down or requirements or restrictions are breached by the offender.

latestSignLockDate.description: An assessment is considered 'Signed and locked' once it is signed by the assessor, making the plan read-only. This is the date the plan has been signed by the assessor.

latestCompleteDate.description: Once a countersignature has been applied to the plan, the plan is considered complete. This is the date the plan has been countersigned.

conditions.condition: You must reside at an approved address
You must not contact the victim
You must reside at an approved address
You must reside at an approved address
You must not leave the country without permission
You must participate in a rehabilitation program
You must comply with electronic monitoring
You must not associate with known criminals

date.description: This field is depreciated and will be removed from the endpoint /v1/epf/person-details/{hmppsId}/{eventNumber} response soon.

sentencingCourt.description: This field is depreciated and will be removed from the endpoint /v1/epf/person-details/{hmppsId}/{eventNumber} response soon.

releaseDate.description: This field is depreciated and will be removed from the endpoint /v1/epf/person-details/{hmppsId}/{eventNumber} response soon.

addressTypeDescription.description: The description of the address type

primaryAddress.description: True if this is the primary address otherwise false

property.description: Building or house number or name

cityDescription.description: The description of the city code

verified.description: Whether the address has been verified by postcode lookup

verifiedBy.description: Which username ran the postcode lookup check

verifiedTime.description: The timestamp of when the postcode lookup was done

mailFlag.description: Flag to indicate whether mail is allowed to be sent to this address

startDate.description: The start date when this address is to be considered active from

endDate.description: The end date when this address is to be considered active from

noFixedAddress.description: Flag to indicate whether this address indicates no fixed address

comments.description: Any additional information or comments about the address

phoneNumbers.description: Phone numbers that are related to this address

createdBy.description: The id of the user who created the contact

createdTime.description: The timestamp of when the contact was created

updatedBy.description: The id of the user who created the contact address

updatedTime.description: The timestamp of when the contact address was last updated

phoneTypeDescription.description: Description of the type of phone

titleCode.description: The title code for the contact

titleDescription.description: The description of the title code, if present

lastName.description: The last name of the contact

firstName.description: The first name of the contact

middleNames.description: The middle names of the contact, if any

dateOfBirth.description: The date of birth of the contact, if known

isStaff.description: Whether the contact is a staff member

deceasedDate.description: The date the contact deceased, if known

languageCode.description: The NOMIS code for the contacts language

languageDescription.description: The description of the language code

interpreterRequired.description: Whether an interpreter is required for this contact

phoneNumbers.description: All phone numbers for the contact

emailAddresses.description: All email addresses for the contact

genderCode.description: The NOMIS code for the contacts gender. See reference data with group code 'GENDER'

genderDescription.description: The description of gender code. See reference data with group code 'GENDER'

userMessage.example: Validation failure: No query parameters specified.

PersonNotFound.description: Failed to find a person with the provided HMPPS ID.

userMessage.example: 404 Not found error: Could not find person with HMPPS id: 2003/0011991D.

developerMessage.example: Could not find person with HMPPS id: 2003/0011991D.

PrisonNotFound.description: Failed to find a prison with the provided prison ID.

userMessage.example: 404 Not found error: Could not find prison with prison ID: MDI.

developerMessage.example: Could not find prison with prison with ID: MDI.

InternalServerError.description: An upstream service was not responding, so we cannot verify the accuracy of any data we did get.

developerMessage.example: Unable to complete request as an upstream service is not responding.

TransactionConflict.description: Duplicate post - The client_unique_ref has been used before

developerMessage.example: Duplicate post - The client_unique_ref has been used before

ForbiddenResponse.description: Forbidden to complete action by upstream service
